title: TEEs
description: A TEE is Trusted Execution Environment.  We (Enarx) define a TEE as "a hardware-based technique for securing sensitive data and algorithms in such a way that even the kernel, root user or hypervisor can't see what's going on."  Examples are AMD's SEV, Intel's SGX and IBM's PEF.  When you need to secure a workload using TEE technology on a host machine, you create a TEE instance.  Intel's SGX calls this an "enclave", AMD's SEV calls this a "secure VM".  We call it a "Keep".
